newsitem.title: USA: AMR Corp taps credit line, lines up new one.
newsitem.headline: AMR Corp taps credit line, lines up new one.

text.p: AMR Corp's American Airlines said it is borrowing $1 billion from an existing credit line and has arranged to borrow another $1 billion under a new credit agreement.

In a filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, American gave notice that it was drawing $1 billion under an existing $1 billion credit agreement which expires in 2001. It said it had not yet borrowed from the new line of credit. It did not say how it would use the funds.
The Fort Worth, Texas-based carrier is in the midst of contract negotiations with its pilots.
